text:
Sorry for the delay here, I'm out of office with limited connectivity so it's not easy to check messages.
Would you mind giving me an example page where this happens?
Forms never include their main default styling when embedded in CMS pages (i.e. `remove HubSpot styling` is always on for the CMS form module), but there's a minimal styling that is always included (this has been so since a long time).
lol Jon, share with him teh page so he can get it working properly. Keep being clever
Someone has more documentation on email_flex_area ?
I usually add {% raw %} for that kind of "complex" CSS
You sir, might be a genious! Never even crossed my mind that raw might prevent minification
maybe its an unexpected feature :thinking_face:
Hi all, this morning we’re having trouble with the API - getting “Not engaged, access_token (XYZ) doesn’t exist! is missing” (where XYZ is a valid token). Any help is appreciated!
Maybe it’s a bug posing as a feature :thinking_face:
Nevermind - this is solved. The tokens are now coming back longer than I allocated for in my database.  I increased that field length and all is good.

Is there any way to submit a form while leaving it on the page? I don't want to redirect or to replace with a thank-you message, I just want it to remain as-is so that the user could submit it again if they want
i hit the search box or command f and type
thats pretty much for all interactions
But I do the searchbox on the templates
sweet deal and thanks for mentioning your fix
I don’t, but I build my own using DM2 Custom Modules
has anyone had any issues with JS Events not binding properly? we have some JS that used to work to refresh a page that had no activity but now it refreshes regardless of activity

I think the javascript form documentation has some callbacks. perhaps you could find out what url the data gets submitted to, submit it yourself, and stop the redirect.

It’s been a long time but one trick we had was we had a button that would appear in the thank you message spot for “Add more” essentially and it would refresh the page(without the submission string in the URL) allowing you to re-submit

Here is a way to submit via an iFrame, but it involves some Javascript coding, and has some caveats. Read the comments fully so you know what the risks are: <https://gist.github.com/hijonathan/9898070>
Can we have CTA's be able to use external website urls with parameters, for some reason the params are being stripped when saving the external website URL cta
Yeah, I've used that before, but it's not quite what I'm looking for. Basically, this form is supposed to alter some other parts of the page without refreshing the page.
Gary and I used that iframe trick to do exactly that on a project - I’m not gonna lie, it was a pain in the butt, but it is possible
Oh, hm

think the basic idea was you submit to the iframe then kickoff whatevers supposed to happen on your page (Whether it’s pulling in  data or whatnot) note there is a lag however between when the form is submitted and when it’s accessible via the personalization tokens and whatnot
